content: भूतिः {%<ab>f.</ab>%} [भू-क्तिन्] {@--1@} Being, existence. {@--2@} Birth, production. {@--3@} Wellbeing, welfare, happiness, prosperity; प्रजानामेव भूत्यर्थं स ताभ्यो बलिमग्रहीत् <ls>R. 1. 18</ls>; नरपतिकुलभूत्यै <ls n="R.">2. 75</ls>; स वोऽस्तु भूत्यै भगवान् मुकुंदः <ls>Vikr. 1. 2.</ls> {@--4@} Success, good fortune. {@--5@} Wealth, riches, fortune; विपत्प्रतीकारपरेण मंगलं निषेव्यते भूतिसमुत्सुकेन वा <ls>Ku. 5. 76.</ls> {@--6@} Grandeur, dignity, majesty. {@--7@} Ashes; भृतभूतिरहीनभोगभाक् <ls>Śi. 16. 71</ls> (where भूति means ‘riches’ also); स्फुटोपमं भूतिसितेन शुंभुना <ls n="Śi.">1. 4.</ls> {@--8@} Decoration of elephants with coloured stripes; भक्तिच्छेदैरिव चिरचितां भूतिमंगे गजस्य <ls>Me. 19.</ls> {@--9@} The superhuman power attainable by the practice of penance or magical rites. {@--10@} Fried meat. {@--11@} The rutting of elephants. --तिः {@--1@} An epithet of Śiva. {@--2@} Of Viṣṇu {@--3@} Of a class of Manes.
